title: 21.1 Disjoint-set Operations
content:
Section 21.1

Disjoint-set Operations

Summary

Data structure for maintaining disjoint sets with efficient union and find.

Key Points

  • MAKE-SET(x): create singleton set containing x
  • UNION(x, y): merge sets containing x and y
  • FIND-SET(x): return representative of set containing x
  • Used for connected components, Kruskal's MST
  • Goal: very fast operations (nearly O(1))

Example

Connected components: MAKE-SET for each vertex. For each edge (u,v), if FIND-SET(u) â‰  FIND-SET(v), UNION(u,v).

Why It Matters

Efficiently track connectivity as edges are added.
